Dear Ms. Peters:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/13/2019. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4605 Plan review.
(1) Plans and specifications shall be submitted to the bureau of
fire services for review and approval prior to any remodeling in a
residential group home or the construction or conversion of a
residential group home.
The fire inspection report dated 08/07/2019 states, “(a) Submit plans of the
installation of the newly installed attic-mounted fuel-fired forced-air furnace.”
Temporary approval is recommended until 10/01/2019. Facility administration states
a contractor is scheduled to address the citation by 09/13/2019. The facility will
supply an updated fire inspection report by 10/01/2019.
R 400.4652 Heating devices and flame producing devices.
(7) A furnace and other flame-producing unit shall be installed
according to manufacturer and test specifications and shall be
vented by metal ducts to a chimney which is constructed of
bricks, solid block masonry, or reinforced concrete which has an
approved flue lining and is properly erected and maintained in
safe condition. A bracket chimney is not permitted. This rule
does not prohibit the installation and use of any prefabricated
chimney bearing the label of an approved, nationally
recognized, independent testing laboratory if it is installed in
accordance with manufacturer and test specifications and is
compatible with the heating unit or units connected to it. Only
gas and oil-fired units may be connected to a prefabricated
chimney.
The fire inspection report dated 08/07/2019 states, “(a) Erect an approved 1-hour fire
resistant enclosure separating the heating appliance from the child occupied areas.
Exposed woof roof members and flooring shall be protected by approved fire-
resistant materials, and (b) The door accessing the newly installed fuel-fired furnace
shall be a minimum B-labeled fire door and frame assembly, equipped with an
approved self-closing device.” Temporary approval is recommended until
10/01/2019. Facility administration states a contractor is scheduled to address the
citation by 09/13/2019. The facility will supply an updated fire inspection report by
10/01/2019.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one corrective action plan this report period. The
10/08/2018 interim inspection report resulted in a corrective action plan regarding
annually updated staff TB tests. The corrective action plan was successful as no
repeat citations are noted.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
